comments.raw_text:
Dear All I guess I have found the problem. I was navigating to the www.bücher.ch page, via a HTML page edited via the SeaMonkey composer. The SeaMonkey composer did accept a non-ascii URL and escaped it. Here is an example, when entering a Link http://www.ονόματαχώρου.com it will generate the following HTML code: Link So when clicking on this link in the browser, the link does not work. But the composer also suggest the puny code. When accepting the puny code, the following HTML code is generated: Link
And this link works fine. But when I edit the link again in the composer, I only see the puny code. Maybe it would be a good idea to show the puny code only in the HTML source view. And convert back to Unicode in the HTML rendered view and the edit dialogs there. Best Regards
comments.creator: janburse@fastmail.fm
